The Dwarven Mines under Laibstadt
Setup
The dwarves keep a subset of the old mines functional and free from vermin for smuggling goods into the city. They don't want to clear out the rest of the mines because they act as a deterent to people. There is an entrance to the tunnels in the basement of the Murengers Arms.
After a while in the tunnels Grundewald will lead them up to a tee intersection, one arm of which is walled off. Grundewald will knock a hole in the wall to allow the characters to climb through. But he will stay by the hole to stop any intrusions into the safe tunnels. Grundewald offers to come in if he hears any trouble (this is the out).
Spiders in the Sewers
They find an old rats skull the size of a football.
Characters in the mines under the city make a perception or dungeoneering check.. difficulty 15. If successful they notice strands of a web like substance running along the ground. If they touch it they feel it give a quick jerk.. like a fishing line. Next round the spiders charge in. If the characters didn't succeed then they are surprised. Grundewald hands the characters an old dwarven map with the relevant path lined out.
Out: The ratmen turn up.
